entry.title: 苹果的下一代 Magic Trackpad 应该配备 Touch ID 传感器（但可能不会）
entry.content:
Jason Snell 在 2022 年 8 月的一篇文章中：

我想快速跟进我最近关于将带触摸功能的 Apple Magic Keyboard 键盘连接到我的桌子底面的文章，因为我现在已经完成了我在那篇文章末尾威胁要做的事情：我已经坏了将其放入键盘中，移除重要部件，然后将其重新组装成一个仅包含 Touch ID 按钮的 3D 打印小盒子。 [...]

无论如何：它有效。但如果苹果能制作一款带有集成 Touch ID 的 Magic Trackpad，我真的会很高兴。

我的办公桌设置：MacBook Pro，盖子合上，连接到 Studio Display，配有我心爱的 Apple Extended Keyboard II，鼠标位于左侧（我习惯用右手做大多数事情，但自学了用左手操作所有鼠标）早在大学时，当我开始出现 RSI 时），右侧还有一个 Magic Trackpad。

与我使用过的任何 Mac 相比，我对这个设置更加满意。但缺点是我没有 Touch ID，因为我的 MacBook 的盖子是关闭的，而且我不使用 Apple 的妙控键盘。因此，在工作日，我倾向于总是佩戴 Apple Watch，这给了我很多与 Touch ID 相同的优势：我可以登录休眠的 Mac，而无需输入帐户密码，并且我可以确认许多操作（例如 Apple Pay 购买） ，并将受保护的文件移至垃圾箱），双击手表上的侧面按钮。

但每当我佩戴其他手表时，我都会非常怀念 Touch ID。不过，我并没有足够怀念这个 DIY 项目，即拆开妙控键盘，将 Touch ID 传感器移动到一个独立的外壳中。所以我希望 (a) Apple 在妙控键盘上添加 Touch ID 传感器；或者 (b) 有人会开始销售装在漂亮盒子里的预装 Touch ID 传感器，这些传感器是从 Magic Keyboard 上改造而来的。为了重新利用 Touch ID 按钮而毁掉 Magic Keyboard 有点浪费，但我很乐意为此付费。虽然我希望苹果能够在 Magic Trackpad 上添加 Touch ID 传感器，但我怀疑他们会这么做——这会玷污 Magic Trackpad 极简的“无按钮”外观，而且对于同时使用 Magic Trackpad 和 Magic Keyboard 的人来说，会给他们两个Touch ID 按钮。

entry.title: “三角测量”——复杂的漏洞利用在 4 年内为未知数量的 iPhone 提供后门
entry.content:
丹·古丁 (Dan Goodin)，Ars Technica 报道：

周三，研究人员针对一次攻击提出了有趣的新发现，该攻击在四年多的时间里给数十甚至数千部 iPhone 留下了后门，其中许多属于莫斯科安全公司卡巴斯基的员工。其中最主要的发现是：未知的攻击者能够通过利用未记录的硬件功能中的漏洞来实现前所未有的访问级别，而除了 Apple 和 ARM Holdings 等芯片供应商之外，很少有人知道这一漏洞。

卡巴斯基研究员鲍里斯·拉林（Boris Larin）在一封电子邮件中写道：“该漏洞的复杂性和功能的模糊性表明攻击者拥有先进的技术能力。” “我们的分析尚未揭示他们是如何意识到此功能的，但我们正在探索所有可能性，包括过去固件或源代码版本中的意外披露。他们也可能通过硬件逆向工程偶然发现了它。” [...]

据俄罗斯政府官员称，大规模后门活动于 6 月曝光，据俄罗斯官员称，该活动还感染了俄罗斯外交使团和使馆内数千名工作人员的 iPhone。卡巴斯基表示，在至少四年的时间里，感染是通过 iMessage 文本传播的，这些文本通过复杂的漏洞利用链安装了恶意软件，而无需接收者采取任何行动。

来自卡巴斯基研究人员的报告：

如果我们尝试描述此功能以及攻击者如何利用它，那么一切都可以归结为：他们能够将数据写入某个物理地址，同时通过写入数据、目标地址、以及将数据散列到固件未使用的芯片的未知硬件寄存器。

我们的猜测是，这个未知的硬件功能很可能是苹果工程师或工厂用于调试或测试目的，或者是被错误地包含在内。由于固件未使用此功能，因此我们不知道攻击者如何知道如何使用它。

entry.title: Apple News+ 增加了 Athletic，但《纽约时报》的文章仍然不可用
entry.content:
托德·斯潘格勒（Todd Spangler）上周为 Variety 报道：

《纽约时报》与 Apple 签署协议，将《The Athletic》的完整体育报道添加到 Apple News+ 订阅包中。此外，《纽约时报》的 Wirecutter 产品评论将从明年初开始免费向所有 Apple News 用户开放。

然而，来自《纽约时报》同名报纸的文章在这家科技巨头广受欢迎的苹果新闻应用程序中仍然不可用。纽约时报公司于 2020 年终止了向 Apple News 提供《泰晤士报》文章的合作关系，当时表示 Apple News 模式不符合该公司的需求，即从数字平台建立“直接路径”，将“读者带回”我们的环境，我们在其中控制报告的呈现、与读者的关系以及我们业务规则的性质。” [...]

The Athletic 拥有超过 450 名全职作家、编辑和制片人。该网站涵盖全球体育联盟的数百支职业和大学球队。其中包括 NFL、NBA、WNBA、MLB、NHL、MLS、英格兰超级联赛、PGA、全国女子足球联盟、NCAA 第一级橄榄球碗分区、NCAA 男子大学篮球、NCAA 女子大学篮球、西甲联赛和欧洲冠军联赛。

我订阅《The Athletic》已有多年，现在将其与我的《泰晤士报》订阅捆绑在一起。正如上面引用的第三段所示，这既好又广泛——他们击败了所有主要球队的编剧。将其添加到News+是News+体育报道的重大升级。没有什么比 The Athletic 更好的了。

不过，奇怪的是，《泰晤士报》认为值得将《The Athletic》（以及《Wirecutter》——与《The Athletic》不同，它很糟糕）与《News+》捆绑在一起，而不是《泰晤士报》本身的内容。另外值得一提的是， 《泰晤士报》去年关闭了自己的体育部门，现在所有体育报道都依赖于《The Athletic》。

entry.content:
乔·罗西尼奥尔 (MacRumors)：

Apple 今天确认，将于 1 月 20 日永久关闭位于加利福尼亚州库比蒂诺的Infinite Loop 零售店。Infinite Loop 在 20 世纪 90 年代中期至 2017 年间曾是 Apple 的总部，当时其目前的 Apple Park 总部在几英里外开业。

苹果将​​为店内所有员工提供继续与公司合作的机会。一位消息人士告诉我们，至少部分员工将能够搬迁到附近的商店，包括Apple Park 游客中心和Apple Valley Fair 。 [...]

该商店于 1993 年首次开业，当时名为 The Company Store，主要销售 Apple 品牌商品。 2015 年翻新后，它作为一家更传统的苹果零售店重新开业，米色桌子上陈列着 iPhone、Mac 和 Apple Watch 等产品，但仍继续销售有限的商品选择，如 T 恤、可重复使用的瓶子、杯子和笔记本。该商店是 Apple 规模较小的门店之一，不提供 Genius Bar 预约或“Today at Apple”创意课程。

Infinite Loop 是苹果爱好者的热门景点，他们经常前往园区和专卖店朝圣。然而，自 2017 年 Apple Park 游客中心开业以来，它的光芒就一直被 Apple Park 游客中心所掩盖。Apple Park 游客中心可以购买不同系列的 Apple 品牌商品，而且该地点也是传统的 Apple 零售店。

我不知道 Infinite Loop 商店出售的商品与游客中心商店不同（据我可靠消息，主要是 T 恤）。我想我只去过那里一次，那是在 2015 年翻修之后。

我想这并不奇怪，但你知道如果IL7 大楼关闭，原来的校园就会遇到麻烦。

entry.title: 科罗拉多州最高法院根据第十四修正案裁定特朗普没有资格担任总统
entry.content:
Dave Pell 在 NextDraft 上写道：

唐纳德·特朗普已被踢出一英里高俱乐部。 科罗拉多州最高法院以 4 比 3 的结果裁定，根据第 14 修正案第 3 条，特朗普没有资格参加该州的投票。 “法官全部由民主党州长任命的法院做出的裁决，标志着历史上首次利用第十四修正案第 3 条来取消总统候选人的资格。”目前，该决定被搁置，让最高法院有时间权衡此事。 [...]

为什么第十四修正案禁止特朗普任职： 宪法学者解释科罗拉多州最高法院裁决背后的原则。在 Slate 中，Lawrence Lessig 解释了为什么第 14 条修正案实际上根本没有这样做：“ 最高法院必须一致否决特朗普取消选票的决定”。阅读完分析后，您可能想将注意力转移到第 21 条修正案，因为您需要喝一杯。

我不喜欢美联社强调科罗拉多州最高法院的法官都是由民主党州长提名的事实——它强调了本应最少党派的政府部门中的党派之争。 （在完成初始任期后，科罗拉多州最高法院的法官必须参加全州选举；其中四位任职这么久的法官已被选民压倒性地保留。）美联社在描述美国最高法院的决定时并没有使用这样的语言。最高法院的 9 名大法官中有 6 名是由共和党总统提名的，而且从未支持选民留任。 （尽管事实是， 在过去 30 年里，选民在总普选中压倒性地支持民主党总统候选人。在里根之后，唯一赢得普选的共和党候选人是 1988 年的乔治·H·W·布什（7.7%）和 2004 年的乔治·W·布什 (2.5%)。）

第十四修正案禁止特朗普再次竞选联邦公职，而且该修正案是自动执行的，这一论点最初是由两位法学教授威廉·鲍德和迈克尔·斯托克斯·保尔森在论文中提出的，他们都是非常保守的联邦主义者协会的成员。这不是什么疯狂的左翼阴谋。

在佩尔的阅读材料清单中，我将添加乔治·康威（George Conway）， 他也在《大西洋月刊》上撰文：

但昨晚我改变了主意。不是因为科罗拉多州最高法院多数派所说的任何话。这三个反对意见让我确信大多数人是正确的。

这些异议令人瞠目结舌——因为他们的软弱。他们不需要合法的技巧，但他们确实缺乏任何令人​​信服的论据。

我发现莱西格关于最高法院应该否决科罗拉多州的论点令人信服，但并不令人信服。关于这件事，我唯一可以肯定的是，如果你认为这不是非常棘手的话，那你就是个该死的傻瓜。如果你认为我们现任的最高法院大法官是共和党人的囊中之物，我并不反对——但我不认为这意味着他们有一刻是橙色耶稣的囊中之物。他们是共和党的黑客，而不是特朗普的黑客。即使是他提名的三位最高法院大法官——戈萨奇、卡瓦诺和巴雷特——也不欠他任何东西，如果有的话，他们可能想维护自己的独立性。我的直觉是，最高法院要么一致裁定第十四修正案不适用于总统候选人，要么做出分歧决定（至少是阿利托和托马斯，也许还有向特朗普卑躬屈膝的戈萨奇），他们会给特朗普一个凯撒，让他远离选票。

乔什·马歇尔：

理查兹经常列出有史以来最伟大的吉他手名单。但在技术层面上，他并没有特别突出。从这一标准来看，曾经的滚石乐队吉他手米克·泰勒（Mick Taylor）过去和现在都更胜一筹。即使是一个普通的摇滚乐迷也可以轻松列出十几位在这一标准上超过他的吉他手。理查兹的天才不是技术熟练，而是知道该弹什么、不弹什么——无论是在作曲天才的意义上，还是在构建不可动摇的连复段时沉默的作用。在采访中，他经常谈到沉默是作曲家的画布。对于一个因放纵而臭名昭著的人来说，他的音乐是建立在经济和克制的基础上的。他痴迷于寻找合适的声音，找到他需要的音调，这导致他开始使用所谓的“开放 G”调弦，这是一种从班卓琴调音演变而来的吉他调音方法。它实际上涉及移除六根弦中的一根。滚石乐队大多数最独特、最难以磨灭的歌曲都是在这次转变之后出现的。您无法用传统调音的吉他演奏大多数滚石乐队的歌曲。很接近。几乎一样，但又不完全一样。

几个月前，理查兹参加了《今夜秀》，并用吉米·法伦代替米克·贾格尔用原声吉他演奏了几首歌曲。 （他做了一个很棒的贾格尔。）这对我来说真是太神奇了。我认为它是一种明显的吉他声音，但事实并非如此。

正如马歇尔（大约是我这个时代的人）指出的那样，在《石头奔跑的几十年》中，理查兹（Richards）并没有说，似乎过着长寿的生活方式。我从小就喜欢滚石乐队（谢谢，妈妈），但希望基思（Keith）不会为这个世界而久。但是我们在这里，而且他不仅在80岁那年还活着，而且还将在1981年Tattoo You以来的Stones最佳录音室专辑背后进行世界巡回演出。什么礼物。

entry.title: [赞助商]黑曜石
Google更改其处理位置历史数据的方式，似乎结束了有争议的“ Geofence Cures”
entry.content:
珍妮弗·林奇（Jennifer Lynch），为EFF写作：

Google本周宣布，它将对其处理用户的“位置历史记录”数据的方式做出一些重要的更改。这些更改似乎使Google对Geofence认股权证提供质量位置数据（即使不是不可能），这是我们一直要求Google实施多年的一种更改。

Geofence认股权证要求提供商（几乎总是Google）搜索其整个用户位置数据储备，以确定执法指定的时间段中位于地理区域内的所有用户或设备。这些认股权证违反了第四修正案，因为它们不是针对特定个人或设备的目标，例如典型的数字通信认股权证。支持Geofence认股权证的唯一“证据”是在特定地区发生犯罪，肇事者可能携带与Google共享位置数据的手机。因此，他们不可避免地会扫除与正在调查的犯罪无关的数百人，并且可以将每个人变成嫌疑人。

Google Maps产品总监Marlo McGriff的公告：Google Maps ：

地图中的时间轴功能可帮助您记住自己去过的地方，并由称为位置历史记录的设置提供动力。如果您是选择打开位置历史记录的用户子集（默认情况下是关闭），那么您的时间表就会在设备上保存下来，这使您可以更多地控制数据。就像以前一样，您可以随时删除全部或部分信息，也可以完全禁用设置。

如果您收到新手机或担心失去现有手机，则可以随时选择将数据备份到云中，以免丢失。我们将自动加密您的后备数据，以便没有人可以阅读它，包括Google。

这些过于广泛的地理诉讼“几乎总是”特有的是Google特有的，这是因为Apple从未收集这样的位置数据，这些数据可以收集到这样的总体中。根据苹果最近的政府透明度报告（PDF），涵盖2022年上半年：

苹果还可能收到政府机构的请求，以寻求与特定纬度和纵向坐标（Geofence）相关的客户数据的请求。 Apple没有任何数据来响应Geofence请求。

我在Apple的消息来源核对，他们认为他们从未收集或存储以某种方式链接到某个地区或地区的个人组。

不过，在Google上更改了这一点。

entry.title: 通用汽车浮动一个废话的“安全”借口，用于丢弃汽车
entry.content:
斯科特·埃文斯（Scott Evans）在今年早些时候宣布通用汽车的公告，称他们将从未来的车辆中撤销Carplay（和Android Auto）的支持：

通用汽车娱乐产品负责人蒂姆·巴比特（Tim Babbitt）在新的Chevrollet Blazer EV的新闻活动中为MT提供了更好的解释，这是No Carplay或Android Auto策略中的旗舰车辆（以及我们2023年的年度最佳赛车赛车赛）。据他说，有一个重要的因素没有将其纳入情况说明书：安全。具体来说，他列举了驾驶员的注意力，这是由于车轮后面的手机使用引起的。

根据巴比特（Babbitt）的说法，Carplay和Android Auto存在稳定的问题，表现为不良的连接，渲染不佳，响应缓慢和连接的下降。当Carplay和Android Auto遇到问题时，驾驶员再次拿起手机，将目光投向了道路，并完全击败了这些电话运输计划的目的。解决这些问题有时可能无法控制汽车制造商。您可以开始看到通用汽车的挫败感。

巴比特的论文是，如果驾驶员要通过车辆的内置系统来完成所有操作，那么他们就不太可能拿起手机，因此分心和更安全的方向盘。不过，他承认，通用汽车尚未在实验室或现实世界中测试这一论文，但认为如果客户愿意，它具有潜力。

多大的马蹄铁。如果Carplay不安全，为什么转基因不召回其配备它的所有现有汽车？最后一句话是真正的踢脚：即使在实验室中，也没有经过测试，但他只是在猜测。在他想象中的场景中，人们在驾驶Carplay Connection剥落时在开车时检查手机。但是，如果汽车不支持Carplay，人们将对手机上的每件事都使用手机，但不在通用汽车的内置系统中。 “如果驾驶员要通过车辆的内置系统来做所有事情”，那就是幻想，例如，“如果驾驶员总是遵守所有发布的速度限制。”这不会发生。没有合理的情况，没有CarPlay支持的未来GM车辆的驾驶员比在支持Carplay的车辆中检查iPhone的频率要少。

当通用汽车继续试图摆脱这个愚蠢的漏洞时，福特首席执行官吉姆·法利（Jim Farley）继续笑：

我们致力于保持Apple Carplay和Android Auto。 @ford客户喜欢这些功能，因为他们有助于将目光投向道路和手上。我们与Apple＆Google紧密合作，为客户创造高质量的体验。而且我认为我们拥有Sync 4A的最佳体验。

足以让您认为通用汽车放弃Carplay的决定是由福特种植的公司中的痣做出的。

更新，12月12日： Motortrend将以下内容附加到故事的底部：

出版此故事后，通用汽车通过以下声明与我们联系：

我们想联系以澄清有关通用汽车在电话预测中的立场的评论被歪曲了，并加强了我们与Apple和Google以及每家公司对驾驶员安全的承诺。通用汽车的嵌入信息娱乐策略是由拥有一个可以与更大的通用汽车生态系统和车辆进行更大整合的系统的好处所驱动的。

通用汽车的某人意识到，这是一个巨大的他妈的，这表明他们在路上有数百万自己的汽车在根本上是不安全的，没有证据。

entry.summary: 这项新功能将为窃取您的iPhone并知道您的设备密码的小偷提供明显的保护。
entry.content:
Joanna Stern和Nicole Nguyen， 《华尔街日报》 （新闻+链接）的报告：

如果您启用了新的被盗设备保护，那么当您离开iPhone熟悉的位置（例如房屋或工作）时，您的iPhone将限制某些设置。以下是概要：

Apple ID密码更改：

  • 如果您什么都不做：小偷可以使用密码更改您的Apple帐户密码并将您锁定。此举是盗贼关闭的关键，找到我的和擦拭电话要转售。由于您是iPhone的所有者，因此没有更改的Apple ID密码，因此您无法立即找到iPhone或远程擦除其数据。

  • 使用被盗的设备保护：如果您想在远离熟悉的位置时更改Apple ID密码，则该设备将需要您的脸部ID或触摸ID。然后，它将在执行操作之前实施一个小时的延迟。那个小时过去了，您将不得不重新确认另一个面部ID或触摸ID扫描。只有这样，密码才能更改。

这听起来像是一个非常周到的解决方案，解决了一个棘手的问题：生物识别技术和时间延迟的结合，当您在已知的工作或家庭等已知地点时，例外。

Stern和Nguyen在今年报道了一系列故事，详细介绍了盗贼（在某些情况下是有组织的犯罪戒指）如何利用您设备密码的上帝般的力量， 这是2月的第一个和4月的后续行动。它的要旨是您的设备密码/密码将控制整个数字王国的钥匙。使用电话和密码，您可以重置iCloud帐户密码并访问保存在钥匙扣中的密码。小偷骗了人们以收集其密封码，然后偷了手机。这不仅授予盗贼访问手机的内容，而且可以访问受害者的银行帐户。并重置受害者的iCloud密码，阻止了受害者远程擦拭，锁定或查找被盗设备。 （骗局会运行的一种方式：在酒吧里聊天受害者，并提出使用目标手机来拍摄受害者和他们的朋友的照片。秘密将手机交给受害者时，将手机锁在脸上。然后，当受害者想在手机上做任何事情时，他们需要输入密码。小偷或团队中的伴侣都会收集密码。然后，他们知道设备密码，偷了电话。）

在Stern和Nguyen打破了这个故事之后，许多人合理地想知道为什么Apple允许您仅使用设备密码重置iCloud帐户密码。客户支持的原因是：每天，数百人 - 大概数千个？ - 因为他们不记得密码，所以人们被锁定在其iCloud帐户之外。 Android手机以相同的方式工作：您可以仅知道您的设备密码重置Google帐户密码。但是，许多人正在利用这一点的盗贼成为受害者，有一些数量级的无辜用户确实知道他们的手机密码，但忘记了他们的iCloud/Google帐户密码。

被盗设备保护可以很好地解决问题，并在安全性和便利性之间保持平衡。没有现有的解决方法是针对了解您的设备密码的小偷的真正防御。 （许多缓解措施都建议使用屏幕时间保护锁定iPhone，但是您可以使用设备密码完全覆盖屏幕时间保护措施 - 它只是增加了一些额外的步骤。

默认情况下，被盗的设备保护将停止，但是在升级到17.3后重新启动时将提示用户有关该功能的提示。这是一个合理的妥协。我对该功能的唯一疑问是“家庭”和“工作”安全地点，其中长达一个小时的延迟被覆盖。 （不过，您仍然需要使用face ID或触摸ID进行身份验证。）如何确定这些位置？我已经在备用iPhone上安装了第一个17.3 Beta，并且在启用了被盗的设备保护后，我尝试更改iCloud密码，但是即使我在家，我仍然需要等待一个小时。 （这款备用iPhone - 我去年的iPhone 13专业人士 - 自9月以来就没有离开我的房子。）

总体而言，这一新功能显然是安全的胜利 - 以及乔安娜·斯特恩（Joanna Stern）和妮可·恩格（Nicole Nguyen）的调查报告的胜利。

entry.title: ★iOS 17.3，现在在Beta中，包括新的“被盗设备保护”功能
Shohei Ohtani's $700 Million Contract With the Dodgers Will Pay Him Just $2 Million Per Year
entry.content:
Lindsey Adler and Richard Rubin, reporting for The Wall Street Journal ( News+ link ):

Shohei Ohtani joined a new team this weekend. You probably heard about it. The Japanese superstar on Saturday agreed to a blockbuster 10-year deal with the Los Angeles Dodgers that will pay him $700 million in total, making it the largest contract in US sports history. But Ohtani won't actually be the highest-paid athlete in America for a while yet. Next season, in fact, the man with the richest contract in baseball history will be making less than some rookies.

Ohtani will take home just $2 million per season over the 10-year span of his contract, which was made official Monday night. In an unprecedented structure, Ohtani will defer $68 million per season until the end of his contract, meaning the Dodgers will pay him $680 million between 2034 and 2043. By the time Ohtani receives his final paycheck from the team, he will be 49 years old 。 [...]

The contract will also have implications for the Dodgers' payroll under MLB's luxury tax rules, which calculates its average annual value based on actual yearly salary ($2 million, in this case) and the present day value of the deal (roughly $44 million). As a result, the Dodgers will take a $46 million hit against their luxury tax payroll each season, a record-setting annual average value, but a steep decrease from a $70 million per year hit if the salary were paid out in full during the course of Ohtani's contract.

This report from the WSJ is the first I've seen that accurately explains the luxury tax implications. All the reporting I read over the weekend, when the news of this unusual structure broke, made it sound like only the $2 million per year they'll be paying Ohtani while he's actually playing over the next decade would count toward the team's payroll, which seemed grossly unjust. $46 million per year seems about right.

Ohtani earns an estimated $45–50 million per year in endorsement contracts , so it's doubtful he'll need to move into the YMCA while wearing Dodger blue. If I were him I'd have pulled a Steve Jobs and taken just $1 per year until the deferments kick in.

★

entry.summary: It's fun watching this cat-and-mouse game from the sidelines, but if I were Beeper, I wouldn't want to be playing.
entry.content:
As hinted by their team over the weekend, Beeper is going to play the cat-and-mouse game with Apple. From cofounders Eric Migicovsky and Brad Murray on the Beeper blog :

We've created an updated version of Beeper Mini that fixes an issue that caused messages not to be sent or received.

That's quite the euphemistic description of the situation.

Phone number registration is not working yet. All users must now sign in with an Apple ID. Messages will be sent and received via your email address rather than phone number. We're currently working on a fix for this.

In other words, what remains broken is the implicit creation of an iMessage account based on the cellular phone number of your device. I described this process in broad terms in a footnote on my column yesterday . It's a magically-invisible-to-the-user process that's been part of iMessage since it first debuted as an iOS-only feature in iOS 5. 1 (At the time, “iOS” covered iPhone, iPad, and iPod Touch.)

The “magic” is that you don't have to sign up for an account, or create a new username or account identifier. You just send a message from your phone number to another phone number, and if both numbers are registered for iMessage, the message goes over iMessage instead of SMS, even if you don't have an Apple ID . Beeper had that working last week. Now, Beeper users need to have an Apple ID, and sign into that Apple ID within Beeper. (Beeper should actively encourage users to create and use an app-specific Apple ID password for Beeper.)

I can confirm that today's update to Beeper Mini in the Play Store restores the ability to use iMessage, if you're signed into an Apple ID.

We've made Beeper free to use. Things have been a bit chaotic, and we're not comfortable subjecting paying users to this. As soon as things stabilize (we hope they will), we'll look at turning on subscriptions again. If you want to keep supporting us, feel free to leave the subscription on 🙂.

对他们很好。 Like I wrote , it was irresponsible to charge a subscription fee for a service they can't guarantee access to.

Beeper Mini launched on Tuesday and rocketed to top 20 of Play Store charts. It was an instant hit. From what we can tell, Beeper Mini was the fastest growing paid Android application launch in history. In the first 48 hours, it was downloaded by more than 100,000 people.

Making it free (instead of a $2/month subscription with 7-day free trial) should only help its popularity, but I think it's an open question how much demand there is for this. iMessage users might wish their Android-owning friends would install it, but are typical Android users interested? If Android SMS users were interested in installing a third-party app to enable better cross-platform messaging, wouldn't they be suggesting to their iPhone-using friends and family that they be the ones who install WhatsApp or Signal or something?

Note: Beeper Cloud's new Oct 2023 iMessage bridge never used Mac relay servers and still does not today. It uses a similar method to Beeper Mini, but runs on a cloud server.

Beeper Cloud was relying on Mac relay servers prior to October. And I think regardless of whether the relay servers are Macs or Linux boxes, it doesn't change the fact that it's a sketchy idea to entrust a relay server with your Apple ID credentials. But I think this recent change to Beeper Cloud means that you can use an app-specific password with that, too, just like with Beeper Mini — you never need to share your main Apple ID password.

Many people have asked, 'why don't people just use Signal or WhatsApp?'. The answer is that Messages App [ sic ] is the default chat app for all iPhone customers. Not only is it the default , iOS makes it impossible to change the default chat app. In the US, where the majority of people have iPhones, this means that the easiest way to chat is by tapping on your friend's name in your contact list and hitting the 'message' button.

This is disingenuous. It is true that Apple does not allow third-party apps to handle anything related to your cellular account. So cellular phone calls only go through the built-in Phone app, and SMS messages only go through the Messages app. Messages isn't merely the default handler for SMS, it's the only handler for SMS. But there is no default for “chat”. iPhone users around the world, in countries where messaging is dominated by apps like WhatsApp or Line , have no problem ignoring Apple's Messages app. People don't start new chats in the Contacts app; they just open the messaging app they want to use. That's the easiest way to chat.

What they're really arguing here is that Beeper is entitled to piggyback on the work Apple has done to make iMessage texting seamless between iOS and Mac users — and more so, that Beeper is entitled to free use of Apple's iMessage server and networking infrastructure .

We deeply object to the allegation that Beeper Mini 'poses significant risks to user security and privacy'.这是完全不真实的。 As we explained above, the opposite is actually true. Beeper Mini increases the security and privacy of both Android and iPhone customers. To prove this, we published a detailed blog post about how the app keeps data secure and private. Beeper Mini is end-to-end encrypted. The underlying connection method is open source , for anyone to review.

Apple guarantees the security of both the protocol (iMessage) and the client software (Messages). In fact, because Messages only runs on Apple devices, Apple further guarantees the security of the underlying operating system and hardware that Messages (the app) runs on, and that all iMessage messages are sent between. With Beeper Mini in the mix, Apple can only guarantee the protocol and your client software, if you're using Messages. Is Beeper Mini storing cached message content and attachments securely on device? Is it transmitting privacy-sensitive metadata back to Beeper with analytics or crash logs? (Beeper Mini has a preference, “Share Diagnostics”, that is on by default but can be disabled.) Beeper can (and does!) vouch for the privacy and security of their client app, but Apple can't. Beeper is correctly arguing that Beeper Mini does not (and cannot) compromise the security of the iMessage protocol, but that doesn't mean that its existence doesn't open security concerns for Apple and its users. And as I wrote yesterday , the existence of an unauthorized client on a supposedly closed platform creates a genuine perception problem for Apple: if Apple can't control the clients permitted to connect to iMessage, it looks like they've lost control of the platform 。 And to some degree, they have lost control over the iMessage platform.

It's fun watching this cat-and-mouse game from the sidelines, but if I were Beeper, I wouldn't want to be playing.

  1. It's worth rewatching Scott Forstall's introduction of iMessage at WWDC 2011 . I know Apple is not going back, but man, I do miss live on-stage demos. The interplay between Forstall and Joz was actually funny, and the demo was completely live. ↩︎

entry.title: Secret Deal With Google Allows Spotify to Completely Bypass Play Store Payment Fees
entry.content:
Adi Robertson and Sean Hollister, reporting for The Verge three weeks ago:

Music streaming service Spotify struck a seemingly unique and highly generous deal with Google for Android-based payments, according to new testimony in the Epic v. Google trial. On the stand, Google head of global partnerships Don Harrison confirmed Spotify paid a 0 percent commission when users chose to buy subscriptions through Spotify's own system. If the users picked Google as their payment processor, Spotify handed over 4 percent — dramatically less than Google's more common 15 percent fee .

Google fought to keep the Spotify numbers private during its antitrust fight with Epic, saying they could damage negotiations with other app developers who might want more generous rates. [...]

But Harrison says Spotify's “unprecedented” popularity was great enough to justify a “bespoke” deal. “If we don't have Spotify working properly across Play services and core services, people will not buy Android phones,” Harrison testified. As part of the deal, both parties also agreed to commit $50 million apiece to a “success fund.”

When this was first reported last month, I installed Spotify on my Pixel phone and tried it myself. Not only does Spotify on Android default to using its own in-app purchasing system — giving not a penny to Google in fees, apparently — but I couldn't even find a way to choose to pay using the Play Store system. Google has granted Spotify a complete exemption to any sort of payment fee, and Spotify simply uses its own in-app payment processing.

On iOS, needless to say, Spotify has no such exemption. I just checked, and all Spotify does on iOS is list the features of each Premium account tier, with a message under each tier that reads “You can't upgrade to Premium in the app. We know, it's not ideal.” They don't even list the prices or tell you where to go to sign up.

So I don't really buy the argument that Spotify's “unprecedented” popularity forced Google to offer this secret sweetheart deal. It doesn't even make sense. Harrison's argument is that Google had to offer Spotify this complete exemption from the regular Play Store payment processing rules because otherwise ... Spotify would have to do the same thing on Android that they do on iOS? It beggars belief that Spotify would pull its app from the Play Store. What makes more sense is that Google wanted to get Spotify — an EU-based company — off their backs as vocal critics of their app store policies, so they offered them this sweetheart deal to shut them up. But it sounds like these sweetheart deals, offered only to large companies like Spotify, are part of what led the jury to rule in Epic's favor in the Epic v. Google lawsuit.

entry.title: Jury Rules for Epic Games in Lawsuit Against Google
entry.content:
Sean Hollister, reporting for The Verge:

Three years after Fortnite-maker Epic Games sued Apple and Google for allegedly running illegal app store monopolies, Epic has a win. The jury in Epic v. Google has just delivered its verdict — and it found that Google turned its Google Play app store and Google Play Billing service into an illegal monopoly.

The jury unanimously answered yes to every question put before them — that Google has monopoly power in the Android app distribution markets and in-app billing services markets, that Google did anticompetitive things in those markets, and that Epic was injured by that behavior. They decided Google has an illegal tie between its Google Play app store and its Google Play Billing payment services, too, and that its distribution agreement, Project Hug deals with game developers and deals with OEMs were all anticompetitive. [...]

Mind you, we don't know what Epic has actually won quite yet — that's up to Judge James Donato, who'll decide what the appropriate remedies might be. Epic never sued for monetary damages; it wants the court to tell Google that every app developer has total freedom to introduce its own app stores and its own billing systems on Android, and we don't yet know how or even whether the judge might grant those wishes.

It's certainly big news that Epic won, but as Hollister makes clear, we have no idea what this will actually mean in practice. I'm still not quite sure what Epic even wants. Android already supports third-party app stores, and Epic already runs one . I think one thing Epic wants is to force Google to allow third-party app stores to be installed without any sort of warnings or friction, which would be a disaster for device security. I've installed the Epic Games app on Android, and the installation and permission-granting process seems perfectly reasonable to me. It just isn't popular.

The other thing Epic wants is to be able to use its own payment processing for apps distributed through the Play Store and Apple's App Store. Implementing such a payment circumvention scheme was what got them kicked out of both stores back in 2021 .

★

entry.summary: The three-day saga of an unauthorized iMessage client for Android.
entry.content:
Beeper is a company founded by Eric Migicovsky, who is best known as the founder of the now-defunct Pebble , which made groundbreaking smartwatches a decade ago . Migicovsky founded Beeper to create a meta-platform for disparate messaging apps — a single messaging client that could connect to dozens of different platforms like WhatsApp, Telegram, Twitter DMs, and more. Until this week, Beeper was best known for an app it has now rebranded as Beeper Cloud . Beeper Cloud works as a single client for a slew of different messaging platforms — including iMessage — by way of relay servers. For each Beeper Cloud user, Beeper runs a virtual server in the cloud, and your local Beeper Cloud app communicates with that relay server. For each messaging service you connect to Beeper Cloud, the relay server needs to store your login credentials. You can also self-host your own server, which they describe as “ possible, but not an easy task right now ”, as it requires Linux system administration skills.

If you're thinking that running a server instance for each user sounds like something that would be hard to scale, you're right. Beeper Cloud launched in January 2021 , but there remains a (seemingly long) waitlist to get access today, nearly three years later.

If you're thinking that giving your iCloud account credentials to a third party so that they can sign you into iMessage on a virtual MacOS machine in the cloud sounds like a sketchy idea, you're correct. It's a terrible idea.

If you're thinking that a scheme like this sounds familiar, you're right — there are a few other “universal chat” services which have also been in the news recently. The best is Texts , a currently-desktop-only $12.50/month app created by Kishan Bagaria, and recently acquired by Automattic (the parent company of WordPress.com, Tumblr, and Day One, among numerous other apps and services ). Texts directly communicates using the protocols for services like WhatsApp and Twitter DMs, but for iMessage — which of course has no open APIs for third-party clients — communicates via AppleScript and accessibility APIs with Apple's Messages app running on your own Mac.

The other such service I'm aware of is Sunbird , which was recently in the news for a partnership with upstart Android phone maker Nothing , wherein they created a white-label Android app called Nothing Chat, that brought iMessage support to Nothing phones by way of relay servers running virtual MacOS instances. Turns out Nothing Chat and Sunbird were a privacy disaster , with message contents and attachments stored unencrypted in a database, and some network traffic being transmitted over unencrypted HTTP. This, despite claims at launch that everything was “end-to-end encrypted”. Nothing Chat was available in the Play Store for just four days last month before being pulled after the security issues were discovered .

So, to recap the various third-party apps that support (or in the case of Sunbird/Nothing, support ed ) iMessage:

  • Beeper Cloud supports iMessage by way of relay servers in the cloud, to use which you must entrust Beeper with your iCloud account password. An app-specific iCloud password won't work, because Messages relies upon your system-level iCloud account on MacOS. [ Update: As of October, Beeper Cloud, although architected to rely upon cloud relay servers, no longer uses Macs .] Beeper also relies upon relay servers for WhatsApp and Signal. Beeper swears up and down you can trust them with this . They even have a client for iOS on the App Store (for now).

  • Texts supports iMessage by communicating with the local instance of Apple's Messages app running on the same Mac Texts is running on. No relay servers, and you never give Texts your iCloud password. It's just one app (Texts) communicating with another app (Messages), both running locally on your Mac.

  • Sunbird/Nothing Chat supported iMessage using relay servers, and it was revealed to be a security fiasco.

That brings us to this week,when Beeper launched Beeper Mini — a $2/month Android app that worked as a standalone iMessage client, thanks to the reverse engineering efforts of a 16-year-old high school student (who goes by “JJTech1030” on GitHub, and apparently wishes to remain pseudonymous). Beeper Mini's launch garnered a lot of press attention — blue bubbles for Android, finally .

Quinn Nelson had early access to Beeper Mini, and made an exemplary video showing it in action and explaining in detail how it worked — including using JJTech1030's open-source proof of concept from the terminal on a Linux laptop. If you're curious about how Beeper Mini pulled this off and what it looked like in action, watch Nelson's video.

I installed Beeper Mini on my Pixel 4, and it worked like a charm. In addition to working seamlessly — including support for group chats, tapbacks (albeit substituting animated emoji in place of Apple's monochromatic badges), undoing sent messages, and editing recent messages — it's just a really nice chat app. It looks a lot like what I'd imagine an official iMessage Android client from Apple would look like. Just like with an iPhone, Beeper Mini even worked without requiring you to sign in to an iCloud account. Beeper Mini reverse-engineered the way that Apple creates a new implicit iMessage account based on your phone number, via a one-time exchange of keys sent through SMS. 1 But, if you wanted to use your existing iCloud account with Beeper Mini, you were able to sign in — which, unlike Beeper Cloud, worked with an app-specific password. When I tried Beeper Mini, I used a secondary iCloud account that I use for testing and product reviews, but even with that account, I would not have signed in if Beeper Mini didn't support app-specific passwords.

Migicovsky told The Verge and Nelson that Beeper believed Apple would be unable to cut off their technique without also breaking iMessage for a significant number of iMessage users on actual Apple devices. I found that hard to believe, given that part of Beeper's technique involves masquerading as a legitimate Apple device, re-using device identifiers. Others speculated that even if Apple could cut off Beeper Mini, either through technical changes or legal threats, they wouldn't, lest they draw the ire of people happy to see iMessage available on Android. Eg, Nilay Patel :

Someone like Beeper finally reverse-engineering iMessage in this was way inevitable and will cause Apple infinitely more pain and bad press in trying to shut it down than if it had just made things interoperable to begin with.

I found that unlikely as well. On Thursday night, two days after Beeper Mini launched, I wrote on Threads and Mastodon :

My prediction is that Apple will make changes — fixing bugs and/or closing loopholes — that break Beeper Mini. It's untenable that there's unsanctioned client software for a messaging platform for which privacy and security are a primary feature.

It's a very nice app, remarkably clever, and for now works like a charm, but if Apple wanted an iMessage client for Android they'd release an iMessage client for Android. Seems irresponsible for Beeper to charge a subscription for an unsupported service.

I think the only way Apple doesn't break Beeper Mini by closing loopholes is if they can't, but I find that unlikely.

Glad I predicted that Thursday night, because on Friday, Beeper Mini stopped working . Apple also issued the following statement, which doesn't mention Beeper by name, but didn't need to:

At Apple, we build our products and services with industry-leading privacy and security technologies designed to give users control of their data and keep personal information safe. We took steps to protect our users by blocking techniques that exploit fake credentials in order to gain access to iMessage. These techniques posed significant risks to user security and privacy, including the potential for metadata exposure and enabling unwanted messages, spam, and phishing attacks. We will continue to make updates in the future to protect our users.

That last sentence translates to “ We'll keep closing loopholes if Beeper Mini finds another workaround. ”

It's true that a lot of people — including me — wish Apple would release an iMessage client for Android. 2 As revealed in a deposition that was part of the Epic v. Apple Fortnight lawsuit, Eddy Cue himself pushed for Apple to release an iMessage client for Android back in 2013 , when Facebook bought WhatsApp for $19 billion. But that's Apple's decision to make, and they obviously decided against it, choosing instead to keep iMessage as a value-add exclusively for Apple devices.

What I meant by it being “untenable” for Apple to look the other way at Beeper Mini wasn't that Beeper made legitimate use of iMessage insecure. That's part of the point of end-to-end encryption. But it was untenable perception-wise for Apple to allow unauthorized client software on a messaging platform heralded first and foremost for its Apple-provided privacy and security. Apple had even lost control over new account signups. That couldn't stand, and that seems so obvious to me that I found it hard to believe Migicovsky truly believed Apple would allow it. 3

But reading Migicovsky's remarks to The Verge's David Pierce in the wake of Apple's response, it seems he really is surprised :

Founder Eric Migicovsky said on Friday that he simply didn't understand why Apple would block his app: “if Apple truly cares about the privacy and security of their own iPhone users, why would they stop a service that enables their own users to now send encrypted messages to Android users, rather than using unsecure SMS?”

Migicovsky says now that his stance hasn't changed, even after hearing Apple's statement. He says he'd be happy to share Beeper's code with Apple for a security review, so that it could be sure of Beeper's security practices. Then he stops himself. “But I reject that entire premise! Because the position we're starting from is that iPhone users can't talk to Android users except through unencrypted messages.”

Well, you know, unless they use WhatsApp or Signal or, now, finally, Facebook Messenger . Again, I wish Apple would release an iMessage client for Android. (But what I really wish is that they'd done so a decade ago, before current platforms had gotten so entrenched, country-by-country around the world.) But I don't buy the argument that Apple is under any sort of ethical obligation to do so. iMessage 如此有价值的部分原因在于它在 iPhone 上的无缝性——使用电话号码作为标识符时，您甚至不需要创建帐户。 What Migicovsky is implicitly arguing is that Apple is obliged to make E2EE messaging as seamless for Android users as they've made it for iPhone users.

  1. This is actually pretty interesting. Part of the onboarding for Beeper Mini on Android requires granting it permission to read and send SMS messages. Beeper Mini does not work as an SMS messaging client (although they supposedly have (had?) plans to add that in the future — on Android, third-party apps can register to serve as the system's default app for SMS, like you can on iOS for things like email and web browsing), but it needs SMS read and write access in order to exchange keys to allow you to register your cellular phone number with iMessage. I believe this is what the Messages app on iPhone does too, but iOS Messages hides this handshake-over-SMS from users — it just happens behind the scenes. On my Pixel, those SMS messages were visible in the system Messages app. First, Beeper Mini sent an SMS to 22223333 (which I presume is an Apple-controlled shortcode?):

     REG-REQ?v=3;t=742427F5960C7B246950C6CD0F8FA3DB C8AF44B268931592099175BAE9D06618;r=2202323240;

    Then 22223333 responded with:

     REG-RESP?v=3;r=2202323240;n=+1267•••••••; s=026570EDECFFFFFFFF6F6BC100F449F092B7ABCB7A85ADDB2B89B9BD64

    (I've replaced the last 7 digits of my Pixel's phone number with bullets in the response. I also added line breaks for formatting — the original SMS messages were one line each.) This request-response handshake seems to be how Apple registers a phone number for iMessage without an associated Apple ID. ↩︎︎

  2. Or open an iMessage API that could be used to create third-party clients like Beeper Mini. But an API seems far less likely than Apple releasing an iMessage app. Apple releasing an iMessage client for Android would be a pleasant surprise; Apple opening a third-party iMessage API would be shocking. ↩︎

  3. It's also the case that Apple just eats the cost of running iMessage — a fast, reliable messaging platform with over a billion users, and, by any reasonable estimate, billions of messages sent every single day (and thus, I'd wager, trillions per year) — at no charge and with no ads, with high-resolution image and video attachments. It's subsidized by the sale of Apple devices. Would it pose a financial hardship to Apple to just offer iMessage free of charge to Android users? No. But the bill for running iMessage is surely significant. The whole business model for Beeper Mini presupposed that Apple should just foot the bill for the usage of Beeper's (paying!) customers, as though iMessage is a public resource, or part of your cellular phone service, like SMS/MMS/RCS. ↩︎︎

entry.summary: 董事会到底是如何直到现在才意识到 Altman 正在领导 OpenAI 走向完全违背其章程的方向，这让我无法理解。这就像“卡萨布兰卡”的警察局长“震惊——震惊！”发现赌博正在*他玩的地方*的赌场进行。
entry.content:
凯文·罗斯，《纽约时报》报道：

周五下午举行的 OpenAI 员工全体会议没有透露更多信息。据一位了解情况的人士透露，该公司首席科学家兼董事会成员伊利亚·苏茨克韦尔 (Ilya Sutskever) 为罢免他的言论进行了辩护。该人士表示，他驳斥了员工的建议，即驱逐 Altman 相当于“敌意收购”，并声称有必要保护 OpenAI 让人工智能造福人类的使命。

奥特曼先生似乎也措手不及。周三，也就是他被解雇的两天前，他为我共同主持的播客“硬分叉”录制了一次采访。在我们的聊天过程中，他没有流露出任何不对劲的迹象，他详细地谈论了 ChatGPT 的成功、他对 OpenAI 的计划以及他对 AI 未来的看法。

奥特曼对他周五离职的具体情况保持沉默。但 OpenAI 联合创始人兼总裁格雷格·布罗克曼 (Greg Brockman) 于周五辞职，以声援奥特曼先生。他发表声明称，他们两人“对董事会今天的做法感到震惊和悲伤”。布罗克曼表示，奥特曼被要求参加周五中午与董事会举行的视频会议，但他立即被解雇了。

卡拉·斯威舍 (Kara Swisher) 昨晚在 Twitter/X 上详细讲述了这个故事：

消息人士告诉我，奥特曼领导下的公司的盈利方向和发展速度可能被认为风险太大，与致力于更加安全和谨慎的非营利一方是不一致的。萨姆一方的一位人士称其为“政变”，而另一位人士则表示这是正确的举动。 [...]

更多信息：投票反对奥特曼的董事会成员认为他控制欲强、任性，想做他想做的事。对我来说，这听起来像是典型的 SV CEO，但这可能不是一家典型的 SV 公司。他们当然有很多解释要做。

布罗克曼（Brockman）一直担任 OpenAI 董事会主席，直到他因抗议 Altman 被解雇而辞职，据他说，直到 Altman 被解雇前 5 分钟，他才知道这一情况。我从来没有听说过公司董事会背着董事长解雇公司首席执行官。

它确实看起来越来越像 OpenAI 内部的深刻哲学裂痕，由 Sutskever（显然还有董事会的大多数成员）领导的主张采取谨慎缓慢且真正非盈利驱动的方法的人与 Altman/Brockman 的“让我们快速行动，改变世界，赚很多钱”的一面。 Sutskever 和 OpenAI 董事会似乎将 Altman/Brockman 视为鲁莽的虚张声势的人；我怀疑奥特曼和布罗克曼将苏茨克弗和他的一方视为一群傻瓜。

一个简单的理解方法是阅读OpenAI 的章程，“我们用于执行 OpenAI 使命的原则”。仅有423字，写得非常浅显。这听起来一点也不像奥特曼一直经营的公司。董事会似乎相信该章程。他们究竟是如何直到现在才意识到 Altman 正在带领 OpenAI 朝着完全违背他们章程的方向发展，这让我无法理解。

这就像卡萨布兰卡的警察局长“震惊——震惊！”发现他玩的赌场里正在赌博。

entry.summary: 我们知道，他们的手机 Snapdragon 芯片在纯粹性能和每瓦性能方面始终落后苹果 A 系列芯片多年，而且没有迹象表明他们正在迎头赶上。那么，他们的 PC ARM 芯片究竟如何击败苹果的 M 系列芯片呢？
entry.content:
Monica Chin 上个月为 The Verge 报道，“ 高通声称其 Snapdragon X Elite 处理器将击败苹果、英特尔和 AMD ”：

高通公司宣布推出新的 Snapdragon X Elite 平台，该平台看起来是迄今为止最强大的计算处理器。这些芯片（包括今天发布的新款 Qualcomm Oryon）采用 4nm 工艺制造，内存带宽为 136GB/s。 PC 预计将于 2024 年中期发货。 [...]

哦，高通还声称其芯片将比苹果的 M2 芯片提供“快 50% 的峰值多线程性能”。这只是一个有趣的说法； X Elite 的核心数比 M2 多 50%，功耗也大得多，因此它在 Geekbench 上的“峰值多线程性能”当然会表现得更好。这就像一个职业短跑运动员吹嘘自己在百米短跑比赛中战胜了一群马拉松冠军。

这个消息太旧了，以至于Chin 不再是 The Verge 的员工（我认为这解释了为什么她没有为新的 M3 MacBook Pro写任何评论） ，但我正在清理旧标签并想对此发表评论。

这是无稽之谈。预计到“2024 年中”才会出现在任何实际笔记本电脑中的芯片将与 Apple 于 2022 年 6 月在 MacBook Air 上首次亮相的 M2 进行比较。因此，即使高通的性能声明属实，并且基于其芯片的 PC按计划发货后，他们正在与苹果两年前推出的芯片进行比较。

另外，他们只是将多核性能与基础 M2 进行比较。他们并不是真正比较多核整体性能，而是“峰值”性能，但这是他们定义的。事实上，他们只提到多核性能，这强烈表明它们在单核性能方面比 M2 慢，这对于大多数消费者/专业消费者用例来说更为重要。

而且：PC 世界似乎没有人关心 ARM 芯片，至少对于笔记本电脑而言是如此。微软在 Surface 系列上取得了成功，但基本上放弃了。我的理解是，当今 PC 销量中基于 ARM 的计算机不足 1%。如果微软不愿意优化 Windows 使其成为 ARM 优先，甚至不愿意将 ARM 视为与 x86 平起平坐，那么当他们自己试图让基于 ARM 的 Windows 笔记本电脑成为现实时，他们为什么现在要这么做呢？

如果 Mac 硬件和 MacOS 是由不同的公司制造，并且 MacOS 软件公司将其操作系统授权给其他 OEM，我真的认为 Apple 芯片硬件不会出现。 Apple Silicon Mac 看似好得令人难以置信的性能是针对软件设计的芯片以及针对芯片设计的非常低水平的软件进行优化的结果。高通不会通过Windows从微软那里获得这一点。

高通的 X Elite 平台可能会击败英特尔和 AMD，但我不确定这在 PC 领域是否重要，除非微软真正在 Windows 上全力支持 ARM。我没有看到这种情况发生。但认为他们正在模糊地赶上苹果芯片的想法是可笑的，而且令人沮丧的是，如此多的科技媒体认真对待高通关于与苹果芯片相对性能的说法。

我们知道，他们的手机 Snapdragon 芯片在纯粹性能和每瓦性能方面始终落后苹果 A 系列芯片多年，而且没有迹象表明他们正在迎头赶上。那么，他们的 PC ARM 芯片究竟如何击败苹果的 M 系列芯片呢？

是的，我早在 2021 年 11 月就预测到了这一点，当时高通声称他们将在 2023 年之前推出用于 PC 的“M 系列竞争性”芯片。就在一年前，高通还声称仍有望在 2023 年出货，所以我也不会屏息等待“2024 年中期”。
